ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
What is your relationship to child?
Notes: 1=Biological Mother; 2=Biological Father; 3=Adoptive Mother; 4=Adoptive Father; 5=Stepmother; 6=Stepfather; 7= Grandparent; 8=Other; 9=Missing; 10 = Other relative

ElementDescription: Do you currently have concerns about your child's behavior or development?
Did your child use single words before the age of 2?
Did you child lose language skills (Stopped speaking for some months after having learned to talk)?
Have you asked a doctor or other professional for help about his/her behavior or development?
Is he/she now able to talk using short phrases or sentences?
Show a normal range of facial expressions?
Use facial expressions that do not match the situation?
Laugh when it is not clear what is funny?
Nod his/her head to mean yes?
Shake his/her head to mean no?
"Point at things at a distance that interest him/her (for example, an airplane)?"
"Use gestures, other than pointing or pulling your hand, to let you know what he/she wants?"
"Use your hand like a tool, or as if it were part of his/her own body?"
Show you things that interest him/her?
"Try to comfort you when you are sad, sick or hurt?"
Seem to want you to join in his/her enjoyment of things he/she likes?
Spontaneously try to copy your actions or those of other people?
"Spontaneously, join in and try to copy the actions in social games-such as Peek-a-boo?"
Play pretend games?
Look up and pay attention to you when you come into a room and start talking to him/her without calling his/her name?
Look at you when he/she wants your attention/help?
Seem interested in children of the same age whom he/she does not know?
Respond positively when a child of the same age approaches him/her?
Invite you to play with him/her?
Demonstrate unusual interests in the sight of things such as close peering or prolonged inspection of things (such as light)?
Demonstrate other sensory interests such as the feel or taste of things or people?
Have any interest that he/she seeks out and that might seem unusual to other people?
Play in repetitive ways with toys or objects (such as lining things ups for long periods of time)?
Have any interests that are unusual in their intensity but otherwise appropriate for his/her age group?
Demonstrate any intense attachments to unusual objects such as a wooden spoon?
"Have any unusual ways of moving his/her hands or fingers, such as flapping his/her hands?"
"Have any complicated movements of the whole body, such as repeatedly bouncing up and down while moving his/her hands? "
Become bothered by minor changes in his/her routine?
"Have things that he/she has to do in a very particular way or sequence, or rituals that he/she insists you go through?"
Bang his/her head or bite or slap himself/herself?
Talk with you just to be friendly (rather than to get something)?
Come get you when he/she needs help?
Smile at friendly adults?
Seem to be more interested in parts of a toy or an object rather than using the toy/object as it was intended?
Use odd phrases or say one thing over and over in almost exactly the same way?
Say or ask the same sequence of things or insist that you say the something in a particular way?
Use overly formal words or phrases so that he/she sounds like a "little adult" or "a little professor"?
Tell you about things that happened in his/her day without being asked?
Get together with particular friends or a best friends?
Offer to share foods or objects with others?
Ask you questions about your experiences or thoughts?
Wave goodbye without being told to do so?
"Seem interested or show pleasure when familiar, adults talk to him/her?"
"Join in activities with children of the same age, without being told to do so?"
Confuse "you" and "I"?
"Say things in unusual, indirect ways?"
Talk about one topic or interest to an unusual degree?
Use words that he/she seems to have invented or made up for her/himself?
Have a special way of saying things?
Seem to notice the facial expressions of others?
Initiate conversations about a range of topics?
Talk so much that it is difficult for others to take a turn?
Participate in social activities with people of the same age during free time?
Seem socially nave when he/she interacts with others?
Say things that sound odd to other people?
Provide excess details when telling you about something?
Insist that others follow very particular rules at school or home?
Become bothered by changes in how his/her personal things are arranged?
"Play cooperatively in games that need some form of joining in with a group, such as a ball game?"
Is he/she now able to talk using short phrases or sentences?
